verbLexeme: 1. To be very pleasing, impressive, or surprising. English = (be) wonderful, (be) delightful, (be) astonishing.
2. To be very pleasing and impressive, almost beyond belief. English = (be) remarkable, (be) marvellous, (be) terrific, (be) fantastic, (be) tremendous, (be) miraculous.
3. To react in pleasure and disbelief at something. English = wonder, marvel.
4. To come from or relate to God. English = (be) holy, (be) divine.
nominalLexeme: 1. A feeling of surprise and amazement. English = wonder, wonderment.
2. A feeling of surprise and pleasure. English = delight.
3. Something which surprises, pleases and amazes; something that is quite unbelievable because it is so surprising, pleasing or amazing. English = wonder; marvel, miracle.
